intro: Jasminum micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, small white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, with opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
